definition: evening snack ("yuruji" means "evening time" and "mun" means "food")
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: gluten (used to make "fuu champuru" which involves mixing it with egg, frying it, and adding vegetables and/or meat)
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: Balinese/Javanese long pepper (scientific name: piper reftrofractum)
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: A kind of seaweed (scientific name: Monostroma nitidum)
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: ゐー　やんべー / ゐー　あんべー
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: that or this (near me) *Note: if something is in front of you, you can say "unu". "Unu" covers a much bigger range of area than the Japanese word "sono"
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: that or this thing near me
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: I see. (This phrase should be followed by an explanation. It's not a stand-alone phrase.)
author: Sherry Schafer

definition:
We/he/she did it! / Bravo!
Offten heard when an Okinawan wins in a national sports competition.

"hyaa" adds a bit of emphasis, but you wouldn't use it when speaking to a superior. In that case, you would just say "shitai" or "shitaisai".
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: I told you so. / Serves you right.
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: Just a sound people make in chants and when doing tug-of-war.
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: ゐー ’わーちち でーびる
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: はじみてぃ やーさい
definition: Nice to meet you. (This phrase is the first thing you say when introducing yourself to someone.)
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: やな ’わーちち でーびる
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: まーから めんそーちゃが
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: まー かい めんせーが
definition: Where are you going? / Where are you headed? (polite)
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: Excuse me (literally: I'm going to be rude.)
author: Sherry Schafer

hiragana: ぐぶりー さびたん
definition: Excuse me for what I did. (literally: I was rude.)

hiragana: ちゃーがんじゅーやみせーみ

hiragana: ふぃーさいびーんやー or ひーさいびーんやー

definition: I want to eat Okinawan soba

hiragana: いっぺー まーさん

definition: I'll be back. You say this when going out and coming back later. (JP: itte kimasu)

definition: Take a break. Rest for a little.

hiragana: うんちけー うんぬきやびーん
definition: I will show you. / I'll guide you.

hiragana: ゆたさるぐとぅうにげーさびら
definition: I hope to have a good relationship with you. (You say this after meeting someone.)

hiragana: うんちけー うにげーさびら
definition: Please show me what to do. / Please guide me.

hiragana: ゆくらち くぃみそーれー

definition: someone older or higher in rank than you; also applies to an older sibling (like JP: senpai)
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: someone younger or lower in rank than you; also applies to a younger sibling (like JP: kouhai)

definition: night of the full moon, 15th day of the 8th month of the lunar calendar

definition: morning star, Venus in the morning sky

definition: weather. Another word for "weather" is "tinchi", but this may be a borrowing from Japanese.

definition: sign of rain, looks like it'll rain

definition: a light shower while the sun shines
author: Sherry Schafer

definition: a wind chill, a cold wind

definition: calm (as in calm seas, calm atmosphere)

definition: night calmness, the quiet of the night

definition: coral reef or rocks that appear at low tide

definition: coral (see also: uuru; Note: "sangu" may have be borrowed from Japanese))
coral (Note: The city of "Uruma" literally means "island of coral".)

definition: coral that kubushimi fish tend to lay eggs in

definition: coral that feels like it burns you when touched

definition: reef pond; the calm shallow part of the sea surrounded by coral

definition: open sea (Note: this is the kanji 沖 in "Uchinaa")

definition: white-flowered gourd; bottle gourd; Lagenaria siceraria

definition: coastal hog fennel, Peucedanum Japonicium (also called: choomiigusa)

definition: taro that is grown in rice paddies (see also: chinnuku)

definition: tomato (lit. Holland (western) eggplant) ; also called: tamatoo

definition: nostoc (a kind of cyanobaterium); also known as "star jelly"
